maintenanceevent.eventdescription: Description based on paper finding aids and inhouse database.

did.unittitle: Archdiocese of Dubuque Collection

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Archdiocese of Dubuque Collection (ADU), University of Notre Dame Archives (UNDA), Notre Dame, IN 46556

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Letters sent by Bishops Loras and Hennessy; manuscripts of lectures by Bishop Loras; drawings of saints for the Dubuque Cathedral; and a Denkschrift of Adam Handl, Richmond (Washington County), Iowa, 1861.

bioghist.head: Background
bioghist.p: The Diocese of Dubuque was erected in 1837 with Jean Mathias Peter Loras as first bishop, succeeded by T. Clement Smyth in 1857 and John Hennessy in 1866.

item.ref: Society for the Propagation of the Faith Records
Catholic Church. Congregatio de Propaganda Fide Records
Center for the Study of Religious Life Records

did.unittitle: Archdiocese of Dubuque: Manuscripts
Bishop Pierre Jean Mathias Loras
Letter to Fr. Edward Sorin from Bishop Pierre Jean Mathias Loras
Letter ("Dear Sir") from Bishop Pierre Jean Mathias Loras
Bishop Loras: notes on temptations,
Bishop Loras: notes on perseverance
did.abstract: All but the title "on perseverance" is in French

did.unittitle: Written description of Bishop Loras
did.abstract: "Tall - about six feet, blue? eyes, brown hair, fair complexion"

did.unittitle: Bishop Loras: 6th lecture, on religious persecutions
Bishop Loras: notes on priesthood
Bishop Loras: notes on the care to be taken of youth
Bishop Loras: notes on motives of conversion
Bishop Loras: notes on education of children
did.abstract: On the same paper: sermon for the Feast of St Raphael, 1844, recommending that we pray to angels, and speaking of his affection for the Irish.

did.unittitle: Bishop Loras: notes - Service de Dieu pendant la jeunesse (in French)
Bishop Loras: notes - Sur le Baptisme (in French)
Bishop Loras: notes on the Christian Priesthood
Notes regarding the history of Saint Raphael Cathedral in Dubuque
did.abstract: Bishop Loras installed, cornerstone laid, etc. 7 notes, probably all written at the same time.

did.unittitle: Bishop Loras: manuscript lectures (30 pages)
Churching Women (liturgy)
Denkschrift
did.abstract: "For the most revered and noble fathers in the provincial concilium to Cincinnati and for the holy apostolic throne in Rome. . . . As soon as a provincial consilium will take place in Cincinnati, the obedient will ask him to listen with the following points most highly acclaimed." Richmond, Washington County, Iowa, 24 April 1861, by Adam Handl, Katholischer Schullehrer [Catholic schoolteacher]. It includes the original manuscript, a 1950s handwritten transcription, and a typed transcription, all in German. The 1950s handwritten transcription was done on the back of history syllabi, including Notre Dame summer school.

did.unittitle: Three letters from Bishop John Hennessy
Letter to James F. Edwards from M. Barry
did.abstract: saying that he has included some circulars, etc., issued by Archbishop John Keane [not enclosed]

did.unittitle: Luigi Gregori drawings for Saint Raphael Cathedral in Dubuque

scopecontent.p: 12 drawings on 11 sheets: Saints Paul?, Dominic, Leo (Pope Leo I), Vincent de Paul, Jerome, Ambrose, Patrick, Francis of Assisi, Bernard (2), Thomas Aquinas, and John Chrysostom. Identifications are in Italian; what we think is St. Paul is not identified and has a bit different look to it than the others.
In four issues of Volume 20, the Notre Dame Scholastic notes that Gregori was working on the Cathedral in 1886: Issue 4, Issue 8, Issue 11, and Issue 13.

Issue 16 mentions Gregori's donation of 21 sketches to the Bishops Memorial Hall at Notre Dame in December 1886. A dozen of these sketches came to the archives. Notre Dame's Snite Museum of Art holds other sketches by Gregori for the cathedral in Dubuque.
